summary: This bill, the Terminating Education Association Congressional Handouts Act (TEACH Act), aims to prohibit the National Education Association (NEA) from lobbying activities. It amends Title 36 of the United States Code to include a section explicitly forbidding the NEA from lobbying.  The bill mandates annual certification from the NEA to the Secretary of Education, assuring non-engagement in lobbying, and sets termination of its federal charter as the penalty for violations.
